page.title: 14COTSWOLD PLANTS
page.content: In 1985 farming practices are often changing .The hedgerows in our country side are freqently sacrificed to make it easier for farmers to move about their land with large machinery .So we have noted down the hedgerows and wildlife that we could see. The road to Ozleworth was bordered by hedgerows in which we saw the following plantlife: Deadly Nightshade Daisy Hedge Woundwort Poppy Blackberry The insects that we saw included Tortoise-shell and Red Admiral butterflies. The hedgerow also provided shelter and food for such birds as Sparrows,Starlings and Pigeons,and small animals such as mice and voles.
